posts._title: Roy William Neill – The Scarlet Claw (1944)
posts.title: The Scarlet Claw
posts.excerpt: Quote:When a gentlewoman is found dead with her throat torn out, the villagers blame a supernatural monster. But Sherlock Holmes, who gets drawn into the case from nearby Quebec, suspects a human murderer.

posts.title: The Shooting Party
posts.excerpt: Quote:At last, the British film classic The Shooting Party receives the digital restoration that does justice to its sweeping vistas and heartbreaking snapshots of an era in its death throes. posts.title: Dead Men Tell
posts.excerpt: Just as elderly Miss Nodbury is ready to leave on a treasure hunt for a family fortune she is scared to death by the ghost of a pirate ancestor. posts.title: Citizen Langlois
posts.excerpt: Citizen Langlois by Edgardo Cozarinsky is an essayistic documentary about Henri Langlois, founder and head of the Cinémathèque française until his death in 1977. posts.title: Cenizas

posts._title: Gerd Kroske – SPK Komplex AKA SPK Complex (2018)
posts.title: SPK Komplex
posts.excerpt: IMDB:The anti-psychiatric Socialist Patients’ Collective (SPK) was founded in Heidelberg in 1970 and attributed individual suffering to society’s capitalist structures. It began as a self-organized experiment in group therapy led by doctor Wolfgang Huber with psychiatric patients, featuring Hegel readings and individual agitation, before subsequently radicalizing, which ended in criminal proceedings against its members, some …

posts.title: IKU
posts.excerpt: Quote:Reiko is a sex robot programmed to accumulate sexual experience. She goes through seven body types to experiences a variety of couplings. She returns to the company to download her accumulated info and escape from their control.
